cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the Yucatan Channel Tuesday night and then north-northwest through the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast late Thursday-Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: somewhere along the Louisiana coast (likely south-central LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect along the U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect along the U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Yucatan Peninsula Tuesday, then the north-central Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Alabama late Thursday into Friday
weather_observation.wind: Low (15%) chance of sustained 39-mph winds late Thursday night through Friday with occasional gusts 30–40 mph if outer bands reach the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Port Freeport based on current forecast track well east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Periodic squalls possible Friday with generally 1–2 inches of rain; amounts over 4 inches are unlikely
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip currents beginning late Thursday
